review:
Being an Overwatch fan is like being ran over by a semi-truck, getting shot by missiles 50 times, shot up in space only to come back plummeting into planet Earth and getting spit on. At least the skins I have are cute! 

(I would love to have the things I paid $40 for, but I guess I can't even have that teehee!)

Overwatch 2 is the bastardization of the actually decent team battle experience that the OG Overwatch was.
It feels like they made a checklist of things that would make the game worse and threw darts at it, and when they weren't satisfied with how bad it was they doubled down.
They removed the things that made Overwatch 1 a truly enjoyable experience and shot the game in the gut.

I guess that is to be expected from a company that is actually on demon time.
> They lied to their player base by falsely advertising features and changes that never made it the game.
> They are money grubbers that sexually abused/molested female employees to the point that a women ended her own life.
> They are breast milk stealing liars that make empty promises, and could care less about their player base and workers that kept the game alive for years.

This is a pitiful attempt to empty the wallets of their dwindling player base

I played for hours on Xbox and PC before Overwatch 2, after trying to play I can't even stomach opening the game, but I did so I could leave this review.

btw TF2 has nearly 3x more active players than OW2
https://store.steampowered.com/app/440/Team_Fortress_2/

Do NOT support this game. Activision ruined in my mind one of the greatest multiplayer shooters in years with OW1 to this because of their greed. They do not care about you and just want to milk this game for as much money as possible.

Overwatch died when jeff kaplan left.

Same as everyone else by the looks of it, 

Blizz as usual is trying to milk every single dollar out of you:
Heroes in battlepass


Overwatch is a game based around hero picks and team synergy. Every single character brings unique advantages, pairing well with some and poorly with others. 

This doesn't sound game breaking at a first glance, but now consider the fact you can queue into competitive games without the full roster of characters.

This is a core gameplay feature, in a competitive game, behind a paywall.

Not worth your time

How can there be fair competition if one team has more options than the other? And purely because they paid for it? Sounds a bit like pay to win, but I'll let you decide for yourself.

I have always loved Overwatch since launch back in 2016 and will continue to love it. That aside, it's very clear the community got screwed over regarding the state of Overwatch 2. The story missions are quite fun, but they aren't much different at all from the event missions in the first game. I wasn't entirely disappointed after finishing the missions because they are fun and the cut-scenes before and after each mission are very interesting as I've always been invested in the plot and world around the game. However, I am a bit hurt there's only 3 missions and that I was able to complete all of them as quickly as I did. The base game is free and I really enjoy it so I do recommend the game 100%, but if you're here for a good PvE experience I will admit your money is likely better spent elsewhere unless you're a total Overwatch nerd like I am.

I am kinda sad, since the new monetisation killed it. The core gameplay is still great, but I find the 5v5 format worse than the 6v6 as well as the balance is all over the place imo.  Overall OW1 > OW2. And when will you update HoTS?

I am forced to review  (THIS) game as an individual entity. So I recommend that game AS a co-op shooter if you need a break from your usual and better quality shooters. 

Overwatch (let's be honest, it's not "2") has been a solid 6/10 team based shooter for years. Simple as that, it's not epic, its not bad... it's just "solid". Remove the Activision/Blizzard tag - the game would do just as well. I'd give it a higher score if it weren't for the cash shops and seasons. That's not content and gaming to me. OW is 50% menus and seasonal challenges.

Played on BattleNet but downloaded here just to leave this review: matchmaking is shit, balance is shit, cosmetics are shit, monetization is shit, community is shit and Blizzard is omega shit. This games is trash and done to smoke, along with the company that makes it .
my disappointment is immeasurable and my day is ruined;

Even though I bought the original Overwatch, I didn't play the game before its release on Steam. After playing for a while now, I honestly can't say if I like it or not. The game plays similarly to the well-known Team Fortress 2, and it's filled with tons more characters and other stuff. Trying out each character and discovering their abilities is fun. The thing I don't really like so far is the length of the matches. I may be in the minority, but I wouldn't mind if each match was a little longer. Sometimes, especially if you are a newbie, the match can be over in ~5 minutes. That doesn't quite fulfill my crave for a good multiplayer game. It also doesn't make me feel like I want to play more. I would rather enjoy a single half hour match than a couple of 5-10 minute games.

I can't say much about paid content and the Battle Pass. If people want to pay for such content and want to be incentivized to keep playing in that way, then they are free to do so. If they don't like it, they can ignore it. As far as I know, it doesn't affect the gameplay in any way. Except for PvE content, that stuff is only available for $$$, I guess? Whatever.

It's hard to say how much more time I'll spend playing Overwatch 2, but I know it was worth a try. If you are a new player like me, I suggest downloading and playing a few matches to see if you like it.
